data.enText: the empty space at the side of a written or printed page

data.chText: 随手写在页边上的笔记
（获胜者在时间或票数上领先的）幅度，差额，差数
data.enText: the amount of time, or number of votes, etc. by which sb wins sth
He won by a narrow margin .

data.chText: 她以领先十秒的优势战胜了其他赛跑者。
data.enText: She beat the other runners by a margin of ten seconds.

data.chText: 你的平均营业利润率是多少？
data.enText: What are your average operating margins?

data.chText: 余地；备用的时间（或空间、金钱等）
data.enText: an extra amount of sth such as time, space, money, etc. that you include in order to make sure that sth is successful

data.chText: 门口狭窄，弄得我倒车时几乎不能出任何差错。
data.enText: The narrow gateway left me little margin for error as I reversed the car.
the extreme edge or limit of a place
the eastern margin of the Indian Ocean
the part that is not included in the main part of a group or situation
people living on the margins of society

data.chText: （基本工资以外的）技术津贴，职务补贴
data.enText: an amount that is added to a basic wage, paid for special skill or responsibility

word_means: 给…镶边；在…加旁注；【股】为…付保险金

means: (获胜者在时间或票数上领先的)幅度，差额，差数
备用的时间(或空间、金钱等)
给…镶边；在…加旁注；【股】为…付保险金

ex.zh: 微弱差距；狭窄的页边空白
大幅度；宽宽的页边空白

tr: allowing some freedom to move within limits
an amount beyond the minimum necessary
the blank space that surrounds the text on a page
example: he jotted a note in the margin

tr: (finance) the net sales minus the cost of goods and services sold
the amount of collateral a customer deposits with a broker when borrowing from the broker to buy securities
the boundary line or the area immediately inside the boundary

value.def: A margin is the difference between two amounts, especially the difference in the number of votes or points between the winner and the loser in an election or other contest.

example.ex: They could end up with a 50-point winning margin...
example.tran: 他们最终可能会以50分的优势获胜。

example.ex: The Sunday Times remains the brand leader by a huge margin...
example.tran: 《星期日泰晤士报》仍以巨大的优势稳居报业龙头的地位。
赞成票以280票比153票的优势领先。

value.tran: (尤指选票或比分的)差额，差数

value.def: The margin of a written or printed page is the empty space at the side of the page.

example.ex: She added her comments in the margin.
example.tran: 她在页边的空白处写下了评语。

value.def: If there is a margin for something in a situation, there is some freedom to choose what to do or decide how to do it.

example.ex: The money is collected in a straightforward way with little margin for error...
example.tran: 钱是直接筹集上来的，不太容易出错。

example.ex: These charges can carry prison terms of up to five years, though there's a wide margin of discretion...
example.tran: 尽管量刑幅度很大，但是这些指控仍面临长达5年的刑期。

example.ex: Out in front, Clarke had built up such a sizeable safety margin that he eased the pace and started cruising.
example.tran: 克拉克远远地开在前面，已保持了一段足够长的安全车距，他于是放慢车速，开始定速巡航。

value.def: The margin of a place or area is the extreme edge of it.

example.ex: ...the low coastal plain along the western margin...
example.tran: 沿着西部边缘的地势低平的沿海平原

example.ex: These islands are on the margins of human habitation.
example.tran: 这些岛屿位于人类聚居地的边缘。

value.def: To be on the margins of a society, group, or activity means to be among the least typical or least important parts of it.

example.ex: Students have played an important role in the past, but for the moment, they're on the margins.
example.tran: 学生过去曾经发挥了重要的作用，不过现在他们变得无足轻重了。

example.ex: ...signs of the party's rapid retreat to the political margins.
example.tran: 该党在政治上迅速失势的种种迹象

value.tran: （社会、群体或活动中的）边缘地位，非主体地位
